reviews.title: Deserves thanks, but not not what we expected
text: So, overall, it was ok.
Boarded the boat at 7pm. First impression  - poor decorations. Could put more into that making it more festive.
Departed at 8.30pm.
Buffett dinner was good and enough, but... lining up in a small space - oh my God! We were literally squeezing ourselves to go through if we needed.

Another thing is it wasn't announced properly how we should line up, in what order. A gentleman was was walking between the tables,  talking to some people and saying something, but not to each table.  As a result, some people came from upstairs, started lining up, some just jumped from the bottom level and lined up... it was a mess!!!

Another thing is that some people got their food and was already chewing yummingly, and we were just swallowing our saliva. If the buffer started being served from 9.10pm, we got our dinner at 10pm!!! I don't think acceptable.
It would be better if waiters were hired for this event and people would sit and receive their dinners in a convenient way, not in a chaos and hungry despair.
Music was good, but songs choices were poor, everything from old times. Not interesting, not appealing at all.
There was no ruffle. It would be nice to include for that money we paid.
If this company would hire an Event Coordinator who would organize games and bring people together, or make the event more entertaining while we were waiting for food at least - it would be the best.

Another thing is that we didn't know who the Captain was, who the Food Manager was, where washrooms were, where the bar was - nothing was introduced to ourselves, we needed to figure all that out. It would be nice to have someone to have a minute in the beginning and to make people comfortable by giving them an introduction.

reviews.title: Sunset Toronto Harbour Dinner Cruise
text: The change from 7 PM to 5:30 PM departure allowed for viewing of the sunset.  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  The chicken dinner with pumpkin pie was delicious.

reviews.title: End of summer cruise
text: Positives..excellent staff, food very good, clean, great DJ
Downside: old boat, rocky boat on the water made me nauseous, table of 10 was too crowded. Price is too high per person for what you get.

reviews.title: Air Show Cruise
text: The boat was very clean,the staff were very friendly and helpful, the buffet lunch was good and plentiful. However, the boat left a few minutes late and could not  get close enough to view the air show. We were forced to go around center island which took a good 45 minutes and so a fair amount of the show was missed. In addition, on this boat there is very little outdoor space so people clustered around windows and railings so not ideal for viewing the show.

reviews.title: Harbour tour
text: we took the cruise yesterday and had a wonderful experience seeing the harbour, around Toronto Island....We got to see the Air Show and it was spectacular! the buffet lunch was very good..the only thing that could be improved upon was that they had announced that somebody would come to tables to direct them to the buffet for orderly fashion..however, that didn’t happen. Some from our area were directed down far set of stairs and the rest took the opposite set...this created two lineups in essence where one line had to try to merge into the other line at a bottleneck...I think the original plan to do it by tables would have been the answer. it was a great cruise and the staff work hard...would do it again!

reviews.title: Awesome music!
text: Great cruise. Good food and the DJ played amazing dance music. Highly recommend. Staff were very friendly and hospitable.

reviews.title: The Best
text: Had the most wonderful time the ambiance, the food was very good and the music was popping I will surely recommend Jubilee Queen and I will be coming back.  The staff were very polite and professional with great smiles they made you feel welcome and appreciated your presence now that is good customer service.  Keep up the good work.

reviews.title: Wonderful Tour of The City at Night
text: The food was delicious.  DJ played great music and the dancing was fun.  Beautiful views of the city.  Our Cousin from Chile enjoyed the cruise.  Will definitely book on the Jubilee Queen again.

reviews.title: Toronto Island cruise and air show Toronto 2019
text: Hello. The cruise was good, and the food was good. Staff was personable. However, I needed a strong zoom lens on my camera to get reasonable pictures of the air show. Had a few fly-bys from the planes. There was crowding to share with other patrons to get good viewing spots due to light rain. The overall experience of the show was poor not satisfactory to possible water restrictions and long distance away of centre stage (at the CNE). Missed one of the acts. Unless you have proper video equipment (a zoom lens or binoculars) for viewing air show was bit disappointing. Not recommended for very young or disabled.

reviews.title: Air show
text: Went to see the air show would not recommend it. it is nearly impossible to get a good view.

The food listed when i bought this wagjag was hamburgers hot dogs and nachos + desert. When on the ship the food was terrible everything was cold and it was 2 pasta salads cannelloni and overcooked chicken breast.
I would not recommend or go again.

reviews.title: Fantastic 55th Wedding Anniversary Cruise!
text: A giant shout out to Ramona (guest services) for making our 55th Wedding Anniversary party a huge success on Saturday June 18th.  The crew, staff and fellow guests on board the ship made for a FUN evening on the Toronto Harbour.  Everyone seemed to be celebrating something, Father's Day, a 50th Birthday party or life!!  The food was delicious, the night skyline beautiful and the dance music fast.  We loved it and also were happy with the Groupon deal. Thanks so much.

reviews.title: Nice experience
text: Was on the cruise years ago (16!!) and returned for an evening cruise for Victoria Day weekend. Easy boarding process, on time, and seating was provided. Service was slow, although the lady serving us was on her first day, so just getting into it... The views are amazing, the night was gorgeous and the entertainment with the DJ was great. The bartender was good too I should add!

The food was actually pretty good, but TAKE NOTE!!! This is not a buffet all you can eat. It is buffet service/style.. go up and they serve you.. but you dont get all you can eat and you dont get as much as you want!

The cruise for the first whle was a lil drab.. back and forth in front of the waterfront.. but got better into the night when we started to go around the channel at the Toronto Islands. Overall was happy, although wouldnt have wanted to pay full pop. Was happy to find a wagjag!

reviews.title: Ship of the damned
text: I spent more than $200 to take my mum and family on a mother's brunch cruise. It was a disaster.  The boarding gangway did not work, so elderly mothers with canes were navigating across slippery decks; and the owner announced the onboard generator was not working well, thus, no music and limited lighting  during the cruise. The worst was to be told there was no running water, so if we "had to go #1 could the entire family go together as a group and only flush once and if we had to #2 to announce it to a crew member so they could manually flush the facility afterwards and to use hand sanitizer because there was no running water."  (we were all left wondering how the crew handling food were cleaning their hands!) It was a drab, boring, soundless, cold, dull cruise. They should have cancelled the cruise rather than ruin it for the 90 passengers identified by the owner!  I would never take this cruise again.

reviews.title: Booking experience
text: There were a few problems booking online - because I didn't know what I was doing!
Mike and Ramona have provided amazing customer service to answer all my questions and deal with my mistakes - I am excited about taking the trip
Karen

reviews.title: Beautiful view of the Toronto Harbour
text: The dinner buffet is really good.  The boat is a little old, but the food, dancing, and beautiful views of the Toronto skyline, more than make up for it.  The DJ has a lot of new music and plays any requests.  Everyone on the cruise had a great time dancing.  It's a wonderful way to spend a summer evening.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Day on the Water to watch air show
text: The owner greeted us at the dock and explained that the air show is unpredictable.  The DJ was there to add to the entertainment and they would play a movie (Top Gun) to fill in the lulls of the air show.
My husband and I totally enjoyed the day on the lake and the luncheon freshly made with terrific flavour by the staff.

The captain positioned the boat in such a way as to get the best views while combating waves and ensuring diesel fumes blew away from us.  Three cheers!  The Snow Bird were enjoyable and we experienced views not afforded on land.  Adversely, we missed lots of parts that those on land would have seen and the commentary.
Overall, the staff were friendly the food delicious (absolutely no one went hungry at the end of the buffet) and the music by the DJ terrific.  Feel free to make a request.

reviews.title: Fun but disappointing at the same time
text: We went with friends who had been on the cruise before so we sort of knew what to expect.  When you get to the boat there is a sign that says "Missed the boat? Take a water taxi".....well the boat waited for people and didn't leave till past 7:30.  Not a big problem but when you've come from out of town and made it on time it is annoying to sit and wait for people who can't get there for the (supposedly) 7 p.m. departure.  Considering we left late we thought they'd keep us out on the water to make up for it, but we actually got back early after just tooting around not really going anywhere.  Disappointing.  The food was good but the way they call the table areas to the buffet was very disorganized so we just went up when we wanted.  We did have a good time, though but I doubt we'd do it again.

reviews.title: highly recommend this cruise
text: We got the wag jag deal and so did most of all the other passengers. We love that people got nicely dressed up for the cruise. Many ladies in club style dresses and heels .  Food was good Chicken and preset tables . The staff could smile more however bartender was very friendly.

reviews.title: Old ship, rationed food, too many people.
text: Not a good experience at all. The "ship" looked like ugly to put in a nice way. Inside decor was non existent. Food was rationed off like at some homeless shelter. Ship departed late, and guests were packed inside like sardines. The music was very very old school.
Groupon had a "deal" for $40, but we were forced to pay another $20 to the company. The booking website is very hard to navigate.
Would never go back!

reviews.title: dinner cruise  wonderful staff great food
text: Had a great time on this cruise the only thing is we were suppose to leave by 7pm and left at 730 pm but they stayed out a half hour longer to make up the difference .The staff were very friendly and the food was very good as well .

reviews.title: Un-necessary Cheapness Diminshes the Experience
text: We were a 2 family group. Phone calls the day prior were not returned. Seating arrangement is tight and you don't get to choose your table. Unfortunately our table was not by the window.

Food is good but rationed. If you were at the end of the line, you will find that some items have run out by the time you reach the buffet. They don't have enough to serve all because they cannot predict what items people would take more from, according to them. And they say they want to avoid wastage. So you the customer might be out of luck with the dinner you paid for if you were at the end of the line. I couldn't believe I was hearing while this part was being explained to me. The food is served on paper plates, and the desert on paper napkins! Other than that, the cruise route and scenery are good. The ship itself is old and needs updating.

reviews.title: Could use some improvement
text: Last night my family and I ended up on the Jubilee Queen. It was an end of summer thing before we get into the busy things of fall like school. It was supposed to be a fun filled entertaining evening. Due to deficiencies in the service, it was less than that.

My biggest complaint is the level of service. I have worked in the service industry for most of my adult life. The fails started at embarkation. The crew couldn't seem to get themselves organised just for the boarding process. It was slow with many trips back and forth between ship and dock  by the crew handling embarkation.

We gave our name and were directed to our picnic table. Two bench seats pressed close together and bolted to the floor with little room on either side. This was done to squeeze as many bodies as possible into a limited space.I'm a bigger guy, and found the seating a little uncomfortable.

That was nothing compared to the horror I saw visited on other people. Other people who were much bigger than I am were also forced to try and squeeze into these terrible benches. All of this when the crew could have made adjustments to their seating charts, since all seating is preassigned, to accommodate these bigger people smoothly and without drama by sending them to the more comfortable seating on the upper deck. Instead these people were forced into these tiny benches.

So we sat at our bench. We noticed a couple tables had received bar service so we tried to catch the eye of either of the servers moving around. We even called out to the one serving the table next to us. She apparently didn't hear us. It would be 2 hours and 51 minutes into the cruise before a server would stop at our table to ask if we wanted anything. I'd already made a trip to the bar myself so we declined.

So let's talk about the food. The food was actually tasty. It was hot were it was supposed to be and the salads were cold like they are supposed to be.. It was served cafeteria style. So the crew offered you each of the selections you could accept or decline. The portions they placed onto the paper plates were generous. You were allowed to go for seconds after everyone had had a first run through. We found that after our first plate we were filled. The only negative was food was not served until 8:30 at night. So if you are planning to do this dinner cruise eat a very late lunch.

The servers need training in how to serve. The servers need to understand that servers should engage with the guests. The servers didn't really seem to care whether we were there or not. When a bartender asks "Have you made up your mind yet?"  that after 30 seconds at the bar. You know some training is needed.

Hair should be neatly tied back. I don't want your hair hanging in my food.  Reaching in front of a guest without a word is rude and wrong. Taking a glass or plate without enquiring if the guest is done with it is also wrong. Yet this was the modus operendi of the servers on the ship.

After dinner we noticed that the ship was pretty much in the same area we had been in for the last hour. For the entire cruise we travelled Toronto Harbour between Queens Quay and The Docks over on Cherry St. the same loop over and over.

We noticed other cruises departing the harbour  through the eastern channel and the western gap and returning . This was kinda what I expected with this cruise. I had earlier noticed the Jubilee Queen during the day exploring Toronto Island and voyaging through more of the harbour, so we were a little disappointed.
The sound system could use some tweaks. The DJ was pretty much unintelligible over the PA. The music had a fuzzy quality to it like some of the speaker cones were blown.

One other thing I found awkward is that being on the main deck all of the interior lights were brightly lit so that the view out the windows was kind of difficult. Perhaps a dimmer for after dinner would enhance the ambience.

The last thing I would mention: Uniform the word means same. I would like to suggest that this be applied to the crew. During our cruise everyone except the bartender had the white shirts with epaulettes, but the pants varied from person to person. Jeggings, tight leggings, untucked shirts etc.. some uniformity of dress would ensure a more professional appearance.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE
text: I found their Groupon advertisements to be very MISLEADING. Claiming a "buffet" style dinner actually means you are swept through the line ONCE and servers PORTION your plate.  And the P.A. system to call tables for dinner was terrible, anyone sitting on the lower level could not hear when their table number was being called.

NOT PUNCTUAL:  We were informed boarding would be at 6:30pm, "shove off" by 7pm and back around 11pm.  The staff were scrambling to set table linings/settings and we didn't "shove off" until 7:45pm, did a few loops in the harbor returned by 10:30. The condition of the boat was dirty and had a lot of spider webs.
VERY UNSATISFACTORY TIME.

reviews.title: Worst experience I have ever paid for
text: This company is purposely misleading in every regard. Firstly, they willfully misrepresent their price on Groupon advertising a 52% discount and claiming the regular price is $79.99 and that they are offering $42 tickets. Their regular price is $58.95 plus a harbour fee plus tax. The deal they are offering is $42 plus that same harbour fee plus tax. The total after tax and fees for the regular price is $79.99 and the total for the deal after tax and fees is $58.95. It's still a discount but I believe they are being purposely misleading about it.

Secondly I called prior to booking.  I also asked about what is included and my friend has a gluten allergy so I asked about food. She told me they would get corn chips for her and that they serve chicken skewers with mango sauce, beef sliders, cheeses, and that I should go to their website and check the menu because she can't pronounce the other items. The online menu confirmed what I was told and included Spanakopita, coffee/tea pastries. It also boasts about having the best cuisine on the harbour for the refined palate..

When we arrived they served us cold Jamaican beef patties, eggrolls, samosa and jalapeno poppers. All of items were stone cold and in the case of the jalapeno poppers completely uncooked. These items are all things that are generally enjoyed warm and cooked and none of them were on the menu advertised. It appeared that they bought a bunch of these things at Costco in the frozen section and instead of heating them just let them thaw.  The servers made many excuses like they were told is was a room temperature menu and that nothing should be heated, that they didn't know about the online menu or what is said. The one girl who had described the menu to me on the phone before booking said that there is a disclaimer that the chef has the right to change the menu (there isn't a disclaimer or even a chef for that matter, they just dumped previously frozen food on a platter). It all was very disgusting and not even close to a suitable replacement for the nice sounding items on the menu.

They gave us drinks and apologised and we tried to enjoy our evening.  However a little while later for no reason at all one server accosted me in the bathroom hallway and said "I hear you had an issue with the food". I said "yes, it was terrible" and she insisted that I listen to her and that the foods were cooked earlier and weren't supposed to be served warm. After arguing for a minute I asked her to walk away,  said: I didn't want to discuss it,  she is the one who came up to me, I wasn't trying to complain further, I just was trying to enjoy the evening, and please leave me alone. She put her foot in the bathroom doorway to block me from leaving or using the bathroom and said "look at you, you are drunk, I should have you kicked off the boat" (I wasn't drunk I had had 3 drinks and I was being harassed by her). I just kept yelling please leave me alone and finally she did. After that another staff came by and gave us like 30 free drink tickets and apologised. The drinks did not help forget that the company purposely misleads guest about their menu, that they literally don't care what they serve us (I am not even sure eating raw jalapeno poppers is food safe-- not that I tried it), and that they think we can be bullied into accepting it. Also I think it violates responsible alcohol serving standards to just throw 30 drink tickets to us (after calling me drunk no less). Finally their boat is decrepit and falling a part and smells like a sewer.
AVOID at all cost

reviews.title: Don't go for the food....go for the fun
text: We went with our adult children and had a great time. The cruise was fun, music was good ( although the sound system had way too much bass for my liking)

If your looking to include good food on your cruise then this isn't the one.  The appetizers we had on our evening cruise was cheese and crackers, cold egg rolls and a couple of other appetizers that should have been warm but were stone cold - very disappointing.

reviews.title: More than what I expected.
text: We throughly enjoyed every minute of the cruise. There has been so much rain this spring/summer and we lucked out by getting a great afternoon for lunch and no humidity. The lunch was perfect with something for all. The covered top of the ship saved us from sunburn. I would recommend this cruise to adults because I think children would get bored. This is not a guided tour which allowed our group of four to talk without interrupting a tour guide. It has been many years since I have seen my hometown from the water. The changes in the cityscape are beautiful. I would do it again.

reviews.title: Mother's Day Brunch cruise
text: Our family really enjoyed the Mother's Day brunch cruise. The food was AMAZING! So fresh and tasty and they managed the buffet lines very well. Very friendly staff. We had 2 toddlers with us and their strollers and the staff were helpful in helping us get to our tables and seat us together. The boat looks a bit dated from outside but is very nice on the inside. We got incredible weather which was a bonus.

reviews.title: Owner of the was very rude and the cruise had no tourist guide
text: We took the cruise on Oct 09, 2016 made a reservation online, when we showed up our name was not on the list. They assigned us table 9 and told us it is by the window, but it was not, they moved us to table 2 then moved us again to table 1. Ten minutes later a big man asked us to move again because the table is reserved, we told him we have been moved 3 times, so he started yelling at us "I am the owner of the ship, if I ask you to move you move or I will ask you to leave the ship" so we asked for a refund, but he walked away. Then he came back and repeated his threats. The activity is pleasant beautiful scenery of the Toronto Island, no audio guide or commentator, lunch was reasonable, apart from the owner's lack of hospitality and rude comments the staff is friendly.

reviews.title: Great sons and mom date
text: My 6 yrs old and 13yrs old sons had an amazing time! The youngest one didnt stop dancing to the music and he actually went for seconds! My 13 yrs old is very hard to please and I over heard him telling his friends about it! the food was great and so was our servers!! It was a great sons and mom afternoon out!

reviews.title: How can Appetizers be classed as a "dinner cruise"
text: Cruise itself was okay but the food was very disappointing. We went expecting dinner (this is why we paid extra for the evening cruise) and got slidders, bruschetta and little phylo pastries.......we left hungry and disappointed! I am not a hard liquor drinker and asked first if they had coolers but was told that even though they are on the drink menu the don't carry them. However the wine spritzer was really good.We boarded late and had to wait over an hour for a couple of stragglers which seemed odd to me that they would wait. Decor was quite nice staff was friendly and the view of Toronto was beautiful but we seemed to cruise back and forth. Glad we got a deal from Wagjag other wise paying full price would have made it a disaster but be aware they tac on lots of extra charges when you book the cruise.

reviews.title: A great night with friends!
text: I went with a group of people a year ago aboard the Jubilee Queen for a dinner cruise around Toronto Island and we decided to go again.

This time we had a group of 20 and it was an amazing evening. The weather was perfect and the sunset outlined a beautiful city skyline. The food was delicious and the waitstaff very friendly. The music was a good mix of tunes and everyone had an amazing time! It was a first Toronto Harbour cruise for many that attended this time around. We're still talking about it. We'll have to do this again!! Thank you to the crew and staff aboard the Jubilee Queen in our celebration of friends!

reviews.title: Try a different cruise line
text: We waited almost an hour to board & the cruise started late.  Dinner was basic, not good & barely warm. Dessert came out very late & no coffee & tea was made due to the generator not functioning, which also caused the lights to go off a few times.

People were tripping over carpets. The boat stayed mainly in the west & did not go through the islands like in past. The cruise was advertised that it ended at 11, but it reality it was 10:30 when we docked so people started leaving then & had to be off the boat by 11 pm.

reviews.title: Fantastic Dinner Cruise
text: This is the first time I've been on the Jubilee Queen and I loved it. The boat was still docked and the music began. My friends and I danced the whole night. The crew members were very friendly. I would go again in a heartbeat. Thank you Jubilee Queen crew, you helped make memories.

reviews.title: Summer Dinner Cruise
text: My two sisters and I went on the Jubilee Dinner Cruise. The weather was warm and sunny. The staff were friendly and helpful. The cruise was advertised as a dinner-dance with top 40's music. On that night there was a family party going on, and all the family members wore red and white outfits. They were a lovely family and all of them enjoyed the dance floor. I found the music was not really top 40's but was typically, more specific to the interests of this family, although it was a public cruise.
I would have enjoyed more of a range of popular music.

The dinner menu was pasta salad, cannelloni, bread rolls, chicken and a green salad. I follow a low carbohydrate diet and would have appreciated a little more variety with the salad, vegetables or meats.
We did have a lovely evening. The evening views on the water are beautiful.

reviews.title: New Years Eve Cruise
text: We booked the Jubilee Queen New Years Eve dinner and cruise and had a wonderful time. The weather was wet and cool, but with the Jubilee Queen fully enclosed and well heated, the weather was not a factor. The meal was good and the entertainment (a DJ and a sax player) was great! Looking forward to booking again for next New Years!

reviews.title: Engagement
text: On October the 6th my girlfriend,now fiancee, family and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner cruise on the Jubilee Queen.The experience is one I won't forget. The food was excellent but most of all the Staff was amazing. I surprised my girlfriend by proposing to her while we danced to our favourite song "This Is Why I Love You"by Major.I asked the DJ if he could play this song,but he didn't have it. He searched online and got the song for me in less the 2 minutes, which I really appreciated. After proposing on the dance floor we returned to our seats and to our surprise the Staff brought over a bottle of Monet Champagne, congratulated us and didn't charge us for it. Also the Bartender brought over two shots of Tequila at no charge as well and congratulated us. All in all it was a beautiful night and I highly recommend to anyone that you will not be disappointed by chosing the Jubilee Queen. Thanks to the Staff for a wonderful experience. My fiancee and I look forward to enjoying another dinner cruise in the future.
Jeff

reviews.title: Welcome Aboard
text: We did a dinner cruise last year on the Yankee Lady from Toronto Harbor . This year we picked the Jubelee Queen . This boat is different from Yankee Lady . It's more a Tom Sawyer style paddle boat , but very clean . The crew were very friendly & helpful . Boarding was rite @ 7pm & set sail by 7:40 . Bar was open @ 7 VERY IMPORTANT !! Ounce we set out crew announced our itinerary , meal time & how we would get our meal . There was a diverse age group on this cruise , Which made it a fun night . After dinner music & dancing started in upper deck . DJ was good & played request . We met fun people & had a great time . Both Yankee Lady &Jubelee Queen are on Wagjag for a good Deal

reviews.title: Good Experience
text: It was my first time on a dinner cruise and I enjoyed myself. The boat had 3 levels, drinks were average price (6-7 bucks) and the food was O-K. I decided to give 3 stars because I don't think it was worth the price, I mean I was lucky enough to purchase mine on groupon but in all I saved 20 bucks. The food is buffet style and was mediocre. All in all I had a good time for my friend's birthday party. I would like to check out the other dinner cruises to be able to give a great comparison.

reviews.title: This is a floating venue!
text: Pretty great experience: staff went out of their way to make my group happy.  We were informed that the ship is trying out new DJs. The DJs of that night were pretty great. Enjoyed the music and the DJ was very happy to TAKE REQUESTS! Few customers weren't happy with all music selections, but I don't think these people knew that they could request songs. I suggest the staff inform customers of this, that would be my only suggestion. Thanks for a great experience.

Also, for those looking for a fun winter activity: this is one of the few cruise ships that run 'til the very end of the season.  They were equipped with a pretty awesome heater, the dance floor was closed off with plastic, which allowed for a warm and beautiful view of Toronto from the water. The food was great and warm, and there was also unlimited tea and coffee served at the end of the cruise. Another suggestion: HOT CHOCOLATE would be great for this venue. I overheard that there is new management and that there are a lot of changes taking place upon this ship. We got to see this for ourselves and it was exciting to be a part of it.
Thanks. Much love.

reviews.title: Good experience for the money
text: It was a good experience for what we paid. It'd be totally worth it, if you buy the ticket on Groupon with the discount. It's kids and family friendly. However, do not expect any fancy ambiance, service, and utensils/plates. The music was nice. The scenery was beautiful. Food was"ok"! Some guests didn't get to eat what they wanted to eat because they were at the end of the line.
